abstract: Editorial contends reputation of Egyptian Army, once respected for playing pivotal role in ouster of Hosni Mubarak, is in tatters; says army is increasingly at odds with people and is contributing to country's instability; cites killing of two dozen unarmed Coptic Christian protesters by security forces and urges military council to investigate.
snippet: The killing of two dozen unarmed Coptic Christian protesters by the military on Sunday is contributing to the country’s growing instability.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: The killing of two dozen unarmed Coptic Christian protesters by the military on Sunday is contributing to the country’s growing instability.

headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Failing Army: The military rulers are contributing to the country’s growing instability
